body:
For choosing a default you need to have an intuition about which is the most common use case. That's where we differ (since we can't possibly measure it).

The fact that someone has 60 assets and considers that to be slow even against localhost... for that one I want to provide a configurable flag, but it is a particular case that does not justify the default in itself in my view.

In all these years almost everyone had the equivalent to :debug => true in dev mode. Because :cache => true was ignored by default. I have not perceived that as a pain point for a majority of users so far. It is the only "measure" I have in mind.

On the other hand, if you turn this off by default, better watch out :debug => true from being accidentally committed.
